item.title: For the First Time in 40 Years EPA to Put in Place a Process to Evaluate Chemicals that May Pose Risk
item.description: WASHINGTON--The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is moving swiftly to propose how it will prioritize and evaluate chemicals, given that the final processes must be in place within the first year of the new law’s enactment, or before June 22, 2017.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: EPA Rebates Will Fund Cleaner School Buses in 88 Communities
item.description: WASHINGTON - The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today awarded more than $7.7 million to replace or retrofit 401 older diesel school buses.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: EPA Prohibits 72 Inert Ingredients from Use in Pesticides
item.description: WASHINGTON--The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is taking action to remove 72 ingredients from its list of ingredients approved for use in pesticide products.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: TODAY: U.S. EPA, U.S. DOJ to Hold Media Call Regarding an Update on the Volkswagen Case
item.description: WASHINGTON – Today at 3:00 p.m. EST, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) will hold an on-the-record call to update members of the news media about the Volkswagen case. There is no embargo on this call
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: Volkswagen to Recall 83,000 3.0 Liter Diesel Vehicles and Fund Mitigation Projects to Settle Allegations of Cheating Emissions Tests on Volkswagen, Audi and Porsche Vehicles
item.description: WASHINGTON – In a second partial settlement announced today by the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: EPA Helps Miami, Fla. Meet Environmental Goals, Foster Economic Development
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today announced that Miami, Fla. is one of 25 communities to receive technical assistance to pursue development strategies that advance clean air, clean water, economic development and other local goals.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Releases Final Report on Impacts from Hydraulic Fracturing Activities on Drinking Water
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: EPA CANCELS Saturday’s open house in East Chicago, Ind., due to possible lapse in federal appropriation funding
item.description: CHICAGO – Based on a possible lapse in funding for the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency beginning at 12:01 a.m. (Eastern Time) on Dec. 10, the Agency has cancelled tomorrow’s scheduled open house / public meeting in East Chicago, Ind., to discuss the USS Lead Superfund cleanup.
item.dc:creator: Region 05

item.title: EPA Adds Subsurface Intrusion to the Superfund Hazard Ranking System
item.description: WASHINGTON — The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today finalized a proposal to expand the hazards that qualify sites for the Superfund National Priorities List (NPL).
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: EPA Proposes Financial Responsibility Requirements for Hardrock Mining Industry
